clinicalDescription: Overview: Inadequate blood supply to the body's organs due to heart dysfunction. Presentation: Hypotension (low blood pressure) oliguria (low urine production), abnormal mental status, cold clammy skin. Assessment: History of physical, abnormal vital signs, poor capillary refilly, tachypnea, tachycardia, rales, gallop or new heart murmur. ECG abnormal, chest x ray with pulmonary congestion, elevated lactate and decreased serum bicarbonate, increased BUN/Cr, abnormal echocardiogram Plan: ICU admission, vasopressor drugs, supplemental oxygen/ventilatory support, diagnosticc coronary angiography. Treat underlying cause (coronary artery revascularization). Prognosis: Highly variable. Prognosis: worse if revascularization delayed beyond 3-6 hours of symptom onset.
